column3: 93 of fulton passed away saturday at hildebrandt hospice center in rochester. born in phoenix
column4: marjorie graduated from phoenix high school and lived in the fulton-phoenix area for many years. she had retired from nestle co. in fulton. marjorie had also owned and operated ye olde milk house in martville. she was a member of the fulton v. f. w. ladies auxiliary and past-president of the fulton american legion ladies auxiliary. marjorie had attended the first baptist church in fulton. she enjoyed traveling
column5: her cocker spaniels and had a green thumb for gardening. she was predeceased by her husband
column8: medora anderson and mayfred bowman. marjorie will be greatly missed and forever loved by her children
column13: robert horton and thomas (carolyn) horton; her brother
column14: wilfred (helen) clark; eight grandchildren; three great-grandchildren; several nieces and nephews. calling hours and services will be private. in lieu of flowers
column15: contributions may be made to hildebrandt hospice center
column24: so sorry for your loss. aunt marge was kind and loving. you are in my thoughts. roberta horton dunn. leave a message of sympathy. name mail (will not be published) your condolence please note: condolence moderation is enabled and may delay your condolence. there is no need to resubmit your condolence. foster funeral home reserves the right to accept in part
